channel.title: Comments on: Open the Simulator sandbox folder of the app you just built and ran
channel.description: iOS Frameworks for speech recognition, text to speech and more

item.title: By: Halle
item.dc:creator: Halle
item.description: Sorry, I don't know of a way to install an app on a device via AppleScript -- good luck!
item.content:encoded: Sorry, I don’t know of a way to install an app on a device via AppleScript — good luck!

item.title: By: sogwiz
item.dc:creator: sogwiz
item.description: Thanks for the useful information. Do you know of a way to use AppleScript to install an app to a device? That is, let's say you just compiled and built your app using a build script (not necessarily XCode). Now you want a script that takes your built app file and deploys it to a device. I'm guessing you'd write some kind of AppleScript to interface with iTunes or the iPhone Configuration Utility. Any suggestions here? Thanks!
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for the useful information. Do you know of a way to use AppleScript to install an app to a device? That is, let’s say you just compiled and built your app using a build script (not necessarily XCode). Now you want a script that takes your built app file and deploys it to a device.
I’m guessing you’d write some kind of AppleScript to interface with iTunes or the iPhone Configuration Utility. Any suggestions here? Thanks!
